title.narrative: INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITIES STRENGHTENED

description.narrative: The government has strengthened commitment and capacity to legislate, plan and budget to extend prevention and response interventions in the area of child protection., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Strengthened multisectoral prevention and management of cases of violence against girls and boys

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The government has strengthened commitment and capacity to legislate, plan and budget to extend prevention and responseinterventions in the area of child protection.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF continued to support;the capacity strengthening of national partners in the areas of;planning for children, coordination of actors involved in child protection and use of evidence for policy making.;More specifically, the review of the National Plan of Action for Children 2008-2015;provides solid ground for the development of the;;next national action plan.;The;ONPPE;received;support to consolidate;its;coordinating;role of;institutional partners and CSOs through the development of a collaborative platform.;The dissemination of MICS6;results;contributed to open;;a cross-sectoral dialogue;and synergies;for;the development of the new CPD.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2022
